content.description: Sit start low on a small right hand incut edge and a left hand side pull under the roof. Huck for the jug directly above, and then follow the winding crack up the face. Mind some loose rock.
content.location: Far left corner of the east side of the boulder

content.description: Sit start on the far right side of the boulder matched on a flat hold. Move into a heinous pocket, and traverse all the way left and slightly down to merge into Problem Child on sweet crimps. Very cool movement. Tops out on Problem Child. Power endurofest.
content.protection: 2 or 3 pads and a spotter is fine, slightly highball~20 feet tall. There are rusty chains on top.
content.location: On the Problem Child bloc starting at the far right side.

content.description: This replaces the old Heat Miser route that fell down in 2012. Shares the same few first bolts and the last two bolts. Everything else has been replaced. Good route. Get on it!
content.location: Same line as the old Heat Miser. Now just to the right of Pheonix and Flying High. See the topo photo on the main 385 page.

content.description: 10 climbing to 11 climbing, to 12c move at the top.
Very nice sidepulls and techy feet.
content.location: This climb starts off the ledge that is up and on the right side of the frontside crag.  Just up and right from Conventional Arms.

content.description: Climbs out of the trees right of hat trick. Hard crimping leads to a ledge rest and then sistained climbing to top.
content.location: Start in trees right of hat trick.

content.description: Start on Not too Shabby and work your way left to finish on Not too Slabby. Fun techy traverse.
content.location: Middle of the east face of the main boulder

content.description: Can be toproped, more often than not it is just bouldered.

Good rock up obvious arete on left edge of wall.  The Pigs (11c) Variation goes to left, Python (12b) breaks away to the right for three bolts before coming back together.  Python has some some really fun sequential moves.
content.location: Left of Hat Trick (11a). Just before you climb over the Boulders to get to the upper wall. It the furthest left route on the lower tier.

content.description: This route is risen from the ashes of the old Heat Miser route when the pillar that formed that route fell down in 2012. Excellent and balancy arete climbing. Small holds. Don't break the potato chip undercling!
content.location: Climbs the arete on the left edge of the upper tier wall at 385. It's about 60 feet left of Goat Debris on the same wall. See the topo photo on the main 385 page.

content.description: One of the nicest, and hardest face climbs in Logan Canyon.  Enduro and sequential crimps with a few jug rests to a crux traverse left around an arete just before the anchors.  You can bail off to the anchors of Nuclear Fingers to the right at the little roof, just before the crux, for "Bailface (12d)."
content.location: This is the obvious gently bulging face that you immediately come to from the approach trail.  There are some pretty obvious large pockets that it starts from.

content.description: Short, bouldery climb.
content.location: This climb starts off the top of the big ledge that sits up and right of the frontside of the crag, just at the mouth of the sheltered cave.  If you are looking into the cave/tunnel from the ledge, it is the only route on your right.

content.description: Excellent, techy face climbing with a powerful crux about 3/4 the way up.  There is a direct start that heads up the right dihedral, which goes at 12c.
content.location: To the right of Paleface, and just to the left of Conventional Arms.

content.description: What I feel is one of the scarier climbs at the crag. Climb up the easy block/slab to the first bolt. Follow the face up through some excellent face climbing to the last bolt, which is way too far below the chains for my taste. Try not to get sucked into the gaping chimney where it feels a bit more secure. Stem and use the arete through the last bit with a traverse to the chains to finish. A fall from near the chains felt like it could be upwards of 20 feet.
content.location: The first route to the left of the cave exit, just right of the fat chimney offwidth with the sharp arete.

content.description: Sit start the right facing large side pull. Make your way up smaller side pulls on the right and a large throw to a good edge with the left, finishing on a techy huck for the top.
content.location: In the middle of the main east face of the boulder

content.description: Sit start with left hand in jug pocket and right on crimp edge (or matched on edge) and make your way up via small crimps and side pulls out left.
content.location: Far right side of the east face on the main boulder.

content.description: This is an excellent line that follows a black streak straight up the middle of the 385 upper tier. Hard climbing from 1/3 height all the way to the top.
content.location: Shares a start and the crux of Up in Smoke, then continues straight up the black streak to the top of the wall. See the topo photo on the main 385 page.

content.description: To the left of Sweet Bonsai is a 3 bolt climb as a short warm up or top rope. Look to the left side and crack edge it offers a nice side pull to get to the second bolt. Think like a trad climber and it will make sense. Two chains at the top easily accessed by walking around on top. This route takes some thought and if your not solid on 5.9 you may want to top rope it first.

Thin and balancy face climbing with some challenging pulls through to some pretty good sidepull corners. This route was largely unaffected when the Heat Miser pillar fell down with the exception of a couple of bolts that needed to be replaced and a bit of crack climbing that is replaced by some thin face climbing.
content.location: Shares the start of Up in Smoke, then cuts right before doing the crux of that route. See topo photo on the main 385 page.

content.description: Easy crack to a harder face.  Really good climb!
content.protection: 6 bolts to a 2 bolt anchor.  You can protect the crack if you want.

content.description: Bolted, steep, and insecure dihedral with unique moves.
content.location: Just around the left corner of the frontside crag.

content.description: One of the nicest climbs for its grade in Logan Canyon.  Either stick clip and do the direct, pockety start (bad landing), or scramble up the left ramp to a large ledge.  From here, a short corner section takes you to the face, with excellent crimps, underclings, and some big reaches.
content.location: The most obvious face on the west facing backside amphitheater of the crag.  Just to the left of "Talk of Town."

content.description: Yes, there is trad in Logan Canyon!  This route starts on a thin slab, protected by bolts that trends up and left.  Then into a steep handcrack, finishing off with a dihedral fingercrack.  Excellent exposure and gear.
content.protection: 3 bolts, handsize and fingersize cams, maybe some medium stoppers.  Bolted anchors.
content.location: Starts off the upper right ledge, just right of Stormin' Norman.

content.description: Excellent, thin face climbing up a blank wall with small hand and footholds. Get your tech on for this one.
content.location: Shares a start and the first four bolts of Pheonix, then trends right up a thin and challenging face, climbing past an 8" roof near the top. Joins Up in Smoke for the last one or two bolts of that route. Pheonix, Up in Smoke and Flying High all share the same anchor. See the topo photo on the main 385 page.

content.description: A sporty crack down low with a high looking first bolt leads to easy blocky 5.9 climbing to the top. Crux is clipping 2nd bolt off of a left hand finger lock way out right.
content.location: First route on your right as you exit the cave. Look for the crack with a high first bolt.

content.description: Direct start to conventional arms.  Start and end on the conventional arete.  Clip 3 bolts on the arete and join up with conventional arms.  Fun reachy moves.
content.location: Start on the arete that is left of original Conventional Arms start

content.description: crux is at 3rd bolt
content.location: Left of what used to be heat miser

content.description: Slabby start, then trend left around the arete to a small ledge just before the crux bulge.
content.location: On the front facing side of the crag, this is the furthest right route before a large alcove formed by a rockfall.  Just right of the direct start to Nuclear Fingers.

content.description: Good route to scramble up top and set a TR. There is a good bolt and lots of boulders with which to make an anchor.
content.protection: Webbing for anchor. Careful of sharp edges.
content.location: Just right of Talk of the Town.

content.description: Squat start matched on the left facing hold and work your way up the edges. Watch for the moss and loose rock at the top.
content.location: Left side of the main east face of the boulder

content.description: Extension to Nuclear Fingers up right dihedral. Finishes on the anchors to Pale Face.
content.location: Start on Nuclear Fingers.

content.description: Just to the right of Sweet Bonsai 5 feet are 3 bolts leading to the top.  This is another nice warm up can be easliy  top roped.  The route goes straight up following the bolt lines with some fun moves. short and sweet.

Another route that takes some balance, pondering, and praying. Climb the slab left of "Burning" up to the high first bolt, then use sidepulls with decent feet up the face to the 2nd. Again, don't deck clipping this bolt. Not as desperate as "Burning" here if your feet are in the right spots. Carefully dance up some more fun face/slab moves to a ledge. Now to tackle the crux roof. The bolt above the roof is a bit out of reach for the average climber from the ledge, so undercling the roof and step high to clip, then back down to rest again. Just above the roof is a bomber left-angling finger crack. Snag that and fight your way up using air for feet and the forest of limestone crystals(some better than others) for additional crimps. Once you've established yourself over the roof, its over.
content.location: Left of "Burning from the Inside" in the cave. Across from "Order and Chaos".

content.description:
Why this and its neighboring slab climb never get done is obvious(because they looks kinda hard, and the first bolts are higher than one might enjoy) but should not deter the adventurous 5.11 climber.

Getting to the first bolt is a bit tricky, but clipping it isn't a problem. The crux section is the next 2 bolts on slippery feet and long reaches to crimps off sidepulls. But is only a 75 degree face, so it should be no problem right? Don't deck clipping the 2nd bolt is all I can say. A throw to a jug(respectively, considering the previous holds). Climb up and clip the bolt over the roof and climb fun crystals to the chains, stemming on the back wall if you feel that isn't cheating. Spicy Burrito!
content.location: In the cave, across from Summer Resort.
